repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
- fix(lua): use luals uv typing
- fix(lua): disable diagnostic for global vim

comment_data.body: Why don't we add a `diagnostic.globals` opt into `.luarc.json` instead
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@
 -- or the test suite. (Eventually the test suite will be run in a worker process,
 -- so this wouldn't be a separate case to consider)
 
+---@diagnostic disable-next-line: lowercase-global

comment_data.body: Because this is the only place this is a problem (because it may not be running inside vim). Otherwise luals will handle `vim` correctly.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@
 -- or the test suite. (Eventually the test suite will be run in a worker process,
 -- so this wouldn't be a separate case to consider)
 
+---@diagnostic disable-next-line: lowercase-global

comment_data.body: `diagnostics.globals` was part of `contrib/luarc.json` before, but then removed when moving it out of `contrib`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@
 -- or the test suite. (Eventually the test suite will be run in a worker process,
 -- so this wouldn't be a separate case to consider)
 
+---@diagnostic disable-next-line: lowercase-global

comment_data.body: Which is why assume that was intentional (on the global level; pun not intended).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@
 -- or the test suite. (Eventually the test suite will be run in a worker process,
 -- so this wouldn't be a separate case to consider)
 
+---@diagnostic disable-next-line: lowercase-global

comment_data.body:
I don't think so; it worked fine before (and after). But I believe the strict typing here is intended, as it's the only related warning.

@gpanders ?
Globals is only needed when you don't have metadata
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@
 -- or the test suite. (Eventually the test suite will be run in a worker process,
 -- so this wouldn't be a separate case to consider)
 
+---@diagnostic disable-next-line: lowercase-global

comment_data.body: I think this one should be removed. `cmd` is not the first argument to `vim.system`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,14 +1,14 @@
 local uv = vim.uv
 
 --- @class SystemOpts
---- @field cmd string[]
---- @field stdin string|string[]|true
---- @field stdout fun(err:string, data: string)|false
---- @field stderr fun(err:string, data: string)|false
+--- @field cmd? string[]

comment_data.body: You mean remove the whole line?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,14 +1,14 @@
 local uv = vim.uv
 
 --- @class SystemOpts
---- @field cmd string[]
---- @field stdin string|string[]|true
---- @field stdout fun(err:string, data: string)|false
---- @field stderr fun(err:string, data: string)|false
+--- @field cmd? string[]

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
---@param list table[] List of quickfix items from |getqflist()| or |getloclist()|.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1692,8 +1691,7 @@ end
 
 --- Convert a list of quickfix items to a list of diagnostics.
 ---
----@param list table A list of quickfix items from |getqflist()| or
----            |getloclist()|.
+---@param list table List of quickfix items from |getqflist()| or |getloclist()|.

@@ -212,15 +212,15 @@ function M.last(versions)
   return last
 end
 
----@class Range
+---@class VersionRange

comment_data.body: I intentionally left these as required in order to resolve the diagnostics some other way.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,9 +17,9 @@
 --- @field deprecated? true
 --- @field returns? string|false
 --- @field returns_desc? string
---- @field signature string
+--- @field signature? string
 --- @field desc? string
---- @field params {[1]:string, [2]:string, [3]:string}[]
+--- @field params? {[1]:string, [2]:string, [3]:string}[]

@@ -1,14 +1,14 @@
 local uv = vim.uv
 
 --- @class SystemOpts
---- @field cmd string[]
---- @field stdin string|string[]|true
---- @field stdout fun(err:string, data: string)|false
---- @field stderr fun(err:string, data: string)|false
+--- @field cmd? string[]

comment_data.body: Well, then these need to be provided for the commands that are missing them (`foreground`, `test_garbagecollect_now`, `test_write_list_log`).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,9 +17,9 @@
 --- @field deprecated? true
 --- @field returns? string|false
 --- @field returns_desc? string
---- @field signature string
+--- @field signature? string
 --- @field desc? string
---- @field params {[1]:string, [2]:string, [3]:string}[]
+--- @field params? {[1]:string, [2]:string, [3]:string}[]

comment_data.body:
Yep, none of these are documented. I'm not sure we even need `foreground()` as it's a no-op. And the `test_*` functions just need a signature/params provided.

Alternatively we could make `signature` optional and derive it from params. Either way I think `params` needs to be required.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,9 +17,9 @@
 --- @field deprecated? true
 --- @field returns? string|false
 --- @field returns_desc? string
---- @field signature string
+--- @field signature? string
 --- @field desc? string
---- @field params {[1]:string, [2]:string, [3]:string}[]
+--- @field params? {[1]:string, [2]:string, [3]:string}[]

comment_data.body:
It's not a bug fix as setting `bufnr` is not required (nor encouraged). These diagnostics are eventually passed to `vim.diagnostic.set()`. The buffer is set there.

`:h diagnostic-structure` indicates which fields are required. The type annotations should be updated to reflect that.

`test_garbagecollect_now` is, so I added the missing required fields.

I added empty keys for the other two; this will add an empty line for them in `builtin.txt`, but I think that's acceptable. Otherwise I can just burninate the two functions (@bfredl?)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,9 +17,9 @@
 --- @field deprecated? true
 --- @field returns? string|false
 --- @field returns_desc? string
---- @field signature string
+--- @field signature? string
 --- @field desc? string
---- @field params {[1]:string, [2]:string, [3]:string}[]
+--- @field params? {[1]:string, [2]:string, [3]:string}[]

comment_regular_data.body: I want in on the fun; this is a warm-up for fixing the "missing fields" diagnostics.

Just a note that I am actively working on https://github.com/luvit/luv/issues/632 which *might* mean the `uv` annotations change from the ones shipped with LuaLS. Hopefully I can keep all the names consistent and under the `uv.` prefix.
I would hope (and expect) LuaLS to adapt to such upstream documentation.

> I would hope (and expect) LuaLS to adapt to such upstream documentation.

The LuaLS shipped types are deprecated AFAIK.

title: fix(lua): typing fixes for luals
